!!WARNING!!: Your code may break after the rollout of the S2 migration if you ignore this message!! If you're not sure whether this applies to you or are unsure about how to fix this semgrep issue, please ask in #feat-s2. 

It looks like you're writing some code which uses a style consumption field. These GUID-backed fields are in the process of being deprecated by the S2 project in favor of new, StyleId-backed fields. Please make sure your code also handles the new StyleId-backed fields, otherwise once the S2 migration is complete and we stop reading from the GUID-backed fields, your code will break.

Typically, all you have to do is make sure that your code also writes to the corresponding StyleId-backed field:
- NodeField::INHERIT_FILL_STYLE_ID -> NodeField::STYLE_ID_FOR_FILL
- NodeField::INHERIOT_FILL_STYLE_ID_FOR_STROKE -> NodeField::STYLE_ID_FOR_STROKE_FILL
- NodeField::INHERIT_TEXT_STYLE_ID -> NodeField::STYLE_ID_FOR_TEXT
- NodeField::INHERIT_EFFECT_STYLE_ID -> NodeField::STYLE_ID_FOR_EFFECT
- NodeField::INHERIT_GRID_STYLE_ID -> NodeField::STYLE_ID_FOR_GRID

If you're reading from these fields, please make sure you're reading from the correct field based on the value of Node::shouldReadS2Fields() — we should read from the GUID-backed field if shouldReadS2Fields() is false, and from the StyleId-backed field otherwise.

For a quick overview of the difference between GUIDs and AssetIds, please read the comment at the top of FGAssetId.h
